name: Blue Corn Cornbread
author: Bill Jezzard
summary: Corn bread made with blue cornmeal and more of almost every ingredient you would put in regular corn bread. It is almost cakelike. This is a pot luck winner.
directions: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix cornmeal, flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt in a bowl
Stir the eggs and milk into the cornmeal mixture
Place the butter in the prepared baking dish, and melt in the preheated oven
Mix hot, melted butter into the cornmeal mixture
Transfer cornmeal mixture to the prepared baking dish
Bake on center rack in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, until the edges of the cornbread pull away from the sides of the dish, and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean
